39475544.review:
One of the greatest tactical shooters ever mad.

No regenerating health. No perk system. No run and gun. You need to think, you need to plan, and you need to execute.

Be warned: One hit WILL kill you. Going in guns blazing WILL kill you. If you play this like the new, dogshit ones, you will lose, you will get butthurt, and you will look like an idiot complaining with a bad review.

Ghost Recon is hard but rewarding.

39398092.review:
Nepoznám zrejme neakeho hráča, ktorý by nepoznal aspoň jednu hru, ktorá má pred meno Tom Clancy. Toto je taktický titul Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon. Odohráva sa vo Východnej Európe vo vtedajšej blízkej budúcnosti - 2008.

+ hratelnosť
+ príbeh
+ herná doba
+ grafika (na rok 2001)
+ cena
+ možnosť dokúpiť 2 DLC

- pre mňa až moc taktické
- niekedy nevyvážená obtiažnosť
- niekedy AI
- mne nastal stereotyp
- občas Vás váš ,,spoluhráč (ala tkz. bot),,
- Multiplayer

7/10

Záver:
Mne už táto hra vo dnešnej dobe veľmi nepotešila. Kupujte ak viete, čo to je alebo viete, čo chcete.

39243293.review:
The only tom clancy game that is better is Vegas 2,
but that being said they are two totally different games.
notice there is no GUN visible!!
every game now (even vegas) has the gun visible but it just blocks half the screen, plus real players know the end of the barrel on those 'guns' doesnt match the cross hairs a lot so if you think about it the hands and gun on the screen are only there for looks pretty much.
This is a game that doesnt rely on looks.
There is an player base still if you can believe it,  on discord.
They are hardcore, expect to get killed if you play 1 on 1, but the coop matches I had were a lot of fun.
I wish tom clany had the balls to make a game like this again but now all they are going to make is games for the general comminity. RB6 siege for example. 
RB6 Siege is pretty much just an wanna be advanced counter strike.
not a bad game but tom clancy has changed his methods a lot between then and now. 
I liked his old games better.

39164951.review:
Warning: This is *not* an arcade FPS! If you will treat is as such, you will fail!

This is a trully merciless, 1 shot 1 kill tactical shooter like they don't make them anymore where you have to be extremely slow, careful and methodical if you want to make any progress.

It must be told that this is the first and only trully hard Ghost Recon game, as the later games in the series only share the name with it but changed up the gameplay to be way more arcadish and merciful.

If you intend to "Rambo" thru the game, you will soon learn that you may not stand much of a chance with such an attitude and may be better off in 100s of other shooter games that allow you to do so.

Thisone is not one of them and you will learn this the hard way.


p.s.: grab "Island Thunder" too, as it adds many cool new missions/maps to the game.

39126751.review:
Играю я  неспеша по паре миссий в день и вот ловлю себя на мысли, что мне действительно интересно. Мне интересно читать брифинг ( Не из-за сюжета, там все ясно - Том Кленси опять угорел по злым русским. Обижаться на это или воспринемать в серьез может только идиот) а из-за информации, которая может быть полезна в ходе миссии. Расстановка противников и локации, боевые задачи и в целом тактическая составляющая на высоте. Игре без малого 20 лет, а экспириенс свеж. Пройти миссию без потерь и со всеми выполненными задачами - настоящее наслаждение. Пару раз даже закуривал, настолько было потно. 


Из минусов конечно же графика, но при этом многие локации и модельки сделаны добротно с любовью.
Чего стоят только модели специалистов, которые открываются по мере прохождения

Рекомендую любителям неспешных тактических шутеров.

In all seriousness it holds up very well and there's not much of a modern equivalent. Do not get shot because there's no health regen or anything you will just die or sustain a lasting injury. It makes you so nervous and forces you to take your time and strategize.

38840460.review:
Now having played Rainbow Six 3 it seems that Ghost Recon was meant to be a lazy spin off of that original trilogy which I will make comparisons of from the perspective of 3 assuming 1 and Rogue Spear had near exact equivalents.

First team selection and customization. There are two different types of soldiers: Standard which are the most disposable things ever and Specialists who are achieved only by completing optional secondary mission objectives. All fall in the class of Assault, Support, Sniper and Demolitions with only a pair of the last three available with Standard at a time 6 being the maximum deployment size. Equipment selection is brought to a minimal with only two pieces: primary weapon, secondary item, no armor selection and all soldiers with NVGs and Binoculars. The amount of primaries are very limited even with Specialists. Secondaries include the (suppressed) M9 pistol, grenade launcher attachments, 2 remote claymores and 6 hand grenades, 2 motion sensors (similar to heartbeat but have to be placed down), extra ammo and exclusive to Demolitions the anti-tank rocket launcher and timed explosive which both are required to complete some mission objectives.

Second team skills. Remember how each Rainbow operative had like 10 different stats despite some not being so important and each started medium to high, would increase a little if they survived a mission and if they died would be replaced only once with someone with a significantly lower amount of skill. In this game there are 4 different stats: Weapon, Stealth, Leadership and Endurance. Each of these can be filled with a maximum of 8 points each. Standards always start out with a total of 7 or 8 points with no skill ever starting with over 2 points and if they survived the mission everyone who took part gets 1 point to put on whichever skill the player wants. The problem is this does not make much diversity in selecting a team because chances are your Standard soldier will die before they make a bell curve on their skills; it is much harder for them to get wounded and it felt like you are using the Replacement Rainbow operatives even sometimes with Specialists.
Endurance which wasn't in R6 is the increased chance that if a soldier is hit they will get wounded.

Third planning and controls. Before and during a mission you are given a full layout of the map with objectives marked. So what about planning? There isn't any like in R6, instead during the mission you have to hold down the map button to select your teams waypoints, engagement options and movement options all while the game still goes on making it risky to send backup if you are engaged. The controls calling All Teams Go/Hold and switching teams/operatives was also complicated. And I guess you can also do the equivalent of Alpha, Bravo, Charlie movements by getting teams in positions, place on hold, mark waypoints moments before you will execute them then command "Advance at All Costs" but that never got to me.

If you like Rainbow Six without the long planning then perhaps this is okay. I also found it more simple using only two teams than three and you can save as much as you want during missions. But being the same price as other Rainbow Six games I would recommend those first over this.

38564313.review:
นี่คือ Ghost Recon ที่ดีที่สุด ถ้าทีม Redstorm เอากลับมา Reboot ใหม่รับรองว่าจะเป็นเกมเทพข้ามศตวรรษแน่นอน

ข้อดี
-สมจริงมากๆ โดนยิงทีเดียวหลับ
-ระบบวางแผนการเล่นทำได้ละเอียดสุดๆ สั่งการทีมเป็นรายตัวได้เลย
-ระบบเสียงยังโคตรเทพกว่าหลายๆ เกมในยุคนี้ด้วยซ้ำ
-ข้อดีที่สุดของเกมนี้คือ เราสามารถสลับไปเล่นทีมของคุณได้ทุกตัวเมื่อไหร่ก็ได้
-ดู Replay เกมการเล่นของคุณได้อย่างอิสระทุกมุมกล้องทั้งมุมมองบุคคลที่ 1 หรือ 3
-บรรยากาศในเกมกดดันและจริงจังมากๆ
-ศัตรูฉลาดและที่สำคัญยิงโคตรแม่น

ข้อเสีย
-ภาพตกยุคไปเท่านั้นเอง เพราะเกมนี้มีอายุ 17 ปีแล้วนะ

38512184.review:
One of the best, hardest, most satisfying shooters i have ever played.
On top of that, it has one of the best multiplayer systems for coop i have ever seen. My father and I played the entire origional game through with just the two of us, no respawns and many retrys later we are proud to have played this through.
This is truely a classic for shooters, well worth the spend,

38438378.review:
My childhood... my first tactical shooter... Holy shit... I remember playing this game for the first time as a kid, I think I was like 12, and while I had played shooters quite a bit and was familiar with Medal of Honor, Unreal Tournament and the like.. this game completely blew me away. I had never played a tactical realistic shooter before and how obscenely different this game played from all the shooters I was comfortable with left an impression on me to this day, and that was just the campaign with AI..which wasnt even bad. The struggle of making sure everyone in your squad stays alive lol. The AI would stalk you quietly, flank you, rush you, or even just camp a corner waiting for you to fuck up. Things got way more hella serious when I played online against other people though... RIP Tom Clancy. They dont make games like they used to.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NwLIHqkqHcw

40330043.review:
Might contain spoilers

This game might not suit you as you might be too familiar/comfortable with fast paced FPS games. This game takes time. Like actual lots of time. Trust me on that. This game requires no inhuman reactions or being good at specific weapon types. The game emphasise on strategic planning and how you want to execute each action, and each action may have magnitude later on. 

Then what is the game like? You have up to 4 objectives for each mission. You will then move on to creating your squad. You can create up to 3 squads, Alpha, Bravo, Charlie. After that you will be send into the field and the game gives you ultimate freedom on which objective you wish to clear first. Once in the field you are literally on your own. There will be no one to direct you on what you need to do. You have been briefed on the situation and thus you have to move accordingly. 

This game is totally different than the FPS that we are playing now. Everything you do in this game will count and you might regret some decisions you make even before entering the field.
